image.altText: A child is given oxygen during medical treatment.

props.synopsis: A boy is left badly burned after an unsafe childcare incident. His parents rush him to hospital to save his finger. It should have never happened.

title.children: Boy left badly burned, blistered and bloody after shocking incident at childcare

image.altText: Residential housing in Gladstone in central Queensland

props.synopsis: Lenders are cutting fixed and variable rates in an attempt to attract customers ahead of a widely anticipated Reserve Bank meeting next week, when the official cash rate is expected to be cut.

title.children: Mortgage wars are heating up ahead of Reserve Bank meeting

image.altText: Anthony Albanese for Speers column

props.synopsis: The Liberals will need as much time as possible before taking on a prime minister determined to tidy up outstanding problems.

title.children: Anthony Albanese has been removing his political vulnerabilities

image.altText: Greens senator Larissa Waters at a pre-poll voting station

props.synopsis: The contest between Greens senators Mehreen Faruqi, Larissa Waters and Sarah Hanson-Young for the party leadership is expected to be "competitive".

title.children: Greens to choose between Faruqi, Waters and Hanson-Young for new leader

image.altText: Donald Trump pumping one closed fist in the air at the top of the stairs to Air Force One.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's visit to the Middle East is certainly sending shockwaves across the region, as the president outlines his vision for vision for relations between the United States and Arab states.

title.children: Cybertrucks and a snub: 5 key takeaways from Trump's day in the Middle East

props.synopsis: It's an exclusive tourist destination and one of the most pristine places on the planet. It's the last place you would expect to find birds with bellies so full of plastic that they crunch if you squeeze them.

title.children: On this island the birds are so full of plastic, they crunch

image.altText: Probowo Subianto and Anthony Albanese shake hands after signing guest book.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will be in Indonesia for just one day on his first trip overseas since winning his second term, but the visit still carries plenty of symbolic weight.

title.children: Albanese visit to Indonesia is quick but loaded with symbolic weight

image.altText: Keir Starmer and Donald Trump shake hands and make eye contact

props.synopsis: The first trade deal struck following Donald Trump's tariff regime has drawn criticism from Beijing, which experts say is also a warning to other countries.

title.children: China sends 'loud and clear' warning over US-UK trade agreement

image.altText: A man in a blue suit speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Tom Fletcher, a top UN aid chief, accused Israel of "deliberately" and "unashamedly" imposing inhumane conditions on civilians in Gaza — something which Israel denies.

title.children: UN Security Council urged to 'act now' and 'prevent genocide' in Gaza

image.altText: Man's hands tape up a box when moving house.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors believe the men were contact with individuals working for Russian state institutions and planned to mail explosives to Ukraine.

title.children: German police arrest three men over alleged Russian parcel bomb plot

image.altText: three men stand together in an opulent gold room

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has met face-to-face with Syria's interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa, the first meeting between US and Syrian leaders in 25 years.

title.children: Trump meets with Syria's president after lifting sanctions on country

image.altText: Two men wearing suits

props.synopsis: The Russian president, who first suggested talks with Ukraine in Istanbul, has not yet responded to Volodymyr Zelenskyy's offer to meet face-to-face to discuss peace.

title.children: Trump and Putin still 'maybes' for Ukraine peace talks

image.altText: A person holds a phone showing an avatar on a map.

props.synopsis: New research shows nearly one in five young adults believe tracking a partner's location is to be expected in a relationship.

title.children: Research reveals location-sharing apps linked to risk of digital coercive control

image.altText: David Mobbs and Kylie Truswell-Mobbs stand arm in arm with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: The son of a Queensland woman accused of murdering her terminally ill partner claims he confirmed with his father that he wanted to overdose, court documents show.

title.children: Son of woman charged with murdering terminally ill partner claims father wanted to overdose, court documents show

image.altText: Dry conditions on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Farmers say while there may be patches of green in paddocks, conditions are much drier than usual. In some parts of Tasmania it's been the driest on record since the 1900s, according to the Bureau of Meteorology.

title.children: Dry conditions challenging Tasmanian farmers as water restrictions kick in

image.altText: Man with grey beard and hat (Craig Eury) holds up rock with fossil tracks in it.

props.synopsis: Fossil footprints found in Victoria by amateur palaeontologists have pushed back our understanding of when an early relative of most land-based creatures first evolved.

title.children: 'Surreal' fossil discovery pushes origin of reptiles back 40 million years

image.altText: A woman in a cap holds her hands out, filled with hazelnuts

props.synopsis: A family-run Tasmanian hazelnut farm that was reluctantly put up for sale last year has not only survived but thrived thanks to finding a market online.

title.children: Online sales to the rescue of struggling hazelnut farm business

image.altText: A woman with her mouth wide open in a parliament ripping a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: In New Zealand, a parliamentary committee has handed down its punishment for the MPs who performed a haka on the chamber floor.

title.children: Māori Party MPs suspended over haka protest in NZ parliament

image.altText: A CCTV still image of a man being attacked in a carpark.

props.synopsis: Locals are concerned over a spate of violent attacks and antisocial behaviour in the inner Perth suburb of Inglewood, with residents calling on the state government to intervene.

title.children: 'We feel scared': Inner-city Perth locals plea for help over safety concerns

image.altText: An external view of Westfield Bondi Junction

props.synopsis: The psychiatrist initially argued on Tuesday that Joel Cuachi's stabbing rampage had "nothing to do with psychosis" during the coronial inquest into the Bondi Junction attack.

title.children: Psychiatrist's evidence branded 'dishonest' after Bondi stabbing flip

image.altText: Storm players celebrate with hugs after Ryan Papenhuyzen of the Storm scored a try

props.synopsis: Melbourne has described the NRL's decision to reject the Storm for next year's Las Vegas season launch as a "missed opportunity", saying the game is neglecting one of Australia's biggest sporting markets.

title.children: 'Missed opportunity': Miffed Melbourne surprised not to be Vegas-bound

image.altText: Jordan De Goey of the Magpies tackles Levi Ashcroft of the Lions

props.synopsis: Collingwood is hoping to regain Jordan De Goey in a "few weeks" as the premiership player deals with a fresh injury setback.

title.children: Collingwood playing 'long game' with injured De Goey

image.altText: A man wearing a spacesuit, smiling.

props.synopsis: How working as a guide in the Arctic Circle led Australian adventurer Eric Philips to be invited to take part in an historic space expedition.

title.children: Australian astronaut didn't expect space to 'affect me so emotionally'

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: Military figures in Ukraine believe a young Australian was killed in the contested Kharkiv region but his remains have not been located.

title.children: Australian tradie who wanted to 'push himself' in Ukraine feared dead

image.altText: A sketch of a greay-bearded man wearing a button-up shirt cupping his face with one hand.

props.synopsis: Peter Sullivan, who spent 38 years, seven months and 21 days in custody, is thought to be the victim of England's longest miscarriage of justice involving a living prisoner.

title.children: Man freed by new DNA evidence after 38 years in prison for murder

image.altText: An aerial shot of an industrial site in a country area.

props.synopsis: Billionaire Andrew Forrest’s company says it needs to find more cost-effective ways to produce hydrogen at scale.

title.children: Fortescue cuts 90 green hydrogen jobs

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie, sitting at a desk inside an office with a view of Darwin Harbour.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Independent Commissioner Against Corruption, Michael Riches, has resigned from his role, the NT chief minister has announced.

title.children: NT ICAC commissioner Michael Riches resigns suddenly

image.altText: an aerial photo of a gold mine.

props.synopsis: A Canadian gold miner has been fined $160,000 for conducting illegal exploration drilling at an Aboriginal sacred site, after the company's own press release tipped authorities off to the damage.

title.children: Judge fines gold mining company for 'mercenary' drilling at sacred site

image.altText: Man walking past a glass window.

props.synopsis: A former Queensland mine operator is contesting allegations he failed to comply with a series of environmental requirements before the company he worked for collapsed.

title.children: Chinese investors controlled collapsed mining company's finances, court hears

image.altText: A woman and a man standing on a stage raise each other's hands

props.synopsis: As the final votes are tallied, here's how the results could shape the future of the Duterte and Marcos clans in the Philippines.

title.children: 'House of Marcos potentially sinking': Fallout from Philippine midterms

image.altText: A woman stands with her hands clasped staring at the camera

props.synopsis: MPs were given a conscience vote on the bill brought by Greens MP Amanda Cohn, which will allow nurse-practitioners and endorsed midwives to prescribe abortion medication for early stage pregnancies.

title.children: Bill expanding access to abortion passes NSW lower house

image.altText: A doctor writing a prescription.

props.synopsis: Gun owners in WA are required to have their doctor to sign off on their mental and physical fitness in order to hold a firearms licence, and that has GPs worried.

title.children: Doctors fear for their safety over new gun laws that requires GP mental health check

image.altText: Hikers bushwalking in the Australian landscape.

props.synopsis: Some NSW national park campgrounds could cost six times more per night if an attempt to standardise fees is adopted, and nature enthusiasts are concerned it will make camping unaffordable for many.

title.children: National parks plan to standardise fees in NSW amid rise in 'ghost camping'

image.altText: An Air Canada plane parked on the tarmac, taken on an unspecified date.

props.synopsis: The 2019 Vancouver to Sydney flight experienced significant turbulence at 36,000 feet. It landed in Honlulu, Hawaii, with 37 injuries recorded, nine of which were major.

title.children: Passengers who claimed injuries from turbulence lose High Court appeal

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman wearing a red blazer and black top, delivering a speech in parliament.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory opposition leader has delivered her first budget reply speech, claiming the jurisdiction's future will be "bleak" under the government's prison-focused crime approach.

title.children: Opposition calls NT budget 'bleak' with 'delusional' solutions to crime
